contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when he heard a voice come from the majestic Glory" or "when the majestic Glory spoke to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when a voice was brought to him by the majestic Glory

contextId.information: The Holy Spirit directed men to speak what God wanted them to speak. This can be stated in active form. AT: "men spoke from God as the Holy Spirit carried them along" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: men carried along by the Holy Spirit spoke from God

contextId.information: The phrase "way of truth" refers to the Christian faith as the true path to God. This can be stated in active form. AT: "unbelievers will blaspheme the way of truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the way of truth will be blasphemed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "these mindless animals are naturally born" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: these mindless animals are naturally made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will destroy them" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "them" refers to the false teachers. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has reserved thick darkness for them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Thick darkness is reserved for them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the command of our Lord and Savior, which your apostles gave to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the command of our Lord and Savior given through your apostles

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God established the heavens and the earth ... long ago by his word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the heavens and the earth came to exist ... long ago, by God's command

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God flooded the world that existed at that time with water and destroyed it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the world of that time was destroyed, being flooded with water

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form and can begin a new sentence. AT: "He is reserving them for the day of judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are reserved for the day of judgment

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Since God will destroy all these things in this way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Since all these things will be destroyed in this way

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "do your best to live in a way so that God will find you spotless and blameless and at peace with him and each other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: do your best to be found spotless and blameless before him, in peace

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that lawless people do no lead you astray with their deceitful words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that you are not led astray by the deceit of lawless people
